title.narrative: Danish Support to Good Governance in Kosovo

description.narrative: Support to good governance sector in Kosovo through: 1) Support to Anti-corruption Efforts in Kosovo (SAEK II) implemented by UNDP and 2) Democratic Society Promotion (DSP II) implemented by Kosovar Civil Society Foundation.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: ANTI-CORRUPTION LEGISLATION AND POLICIES DEVELOPED AND CAPACITIES FOR IMPLEMENTATION FOSTERED
Targets are to be fully measured after full implementation in 2020, eventhough Danida supports terminates by end 2018.

target.value: 1.1. No of cases resolved vs. No of cases submitted on corruption by anti-corruption institutions. 1.2. No. ff judges and prosecutors under procedure for exceeding the legal deadlines. 1.3. At least 80% of Anti-Corruption Strategy 2013-2017 implemented by 2017. 1.4. No. Of cases reported through Kallxo.com that are receiving legally prescribed action by authorities concerned.

actual.value: 1.1 In 2017: 1.036 cases received. out of which 81% are resolved. 1.2. 6 judges and 3 prosecutors disciplined in 2017. 1.3. Out of total 120 actions foreseen to be implemented. 78 have been implemented or 65%. while 12 actions have not been implemented. The remaining 30 actions have not been reported on weather have been implemented or not. 1.4. Out of total 1.213 cases. 224 have been processed further or 18.5%.

target.value: Anti-corruption Strategy and Action Plan 2018-2022 drafted

actual.value: The new 2018-2022 Anti-corruption Strategy and accompanying Action Plan (developed with the support of the project in 2017). was finally adopted by the central level authorities in March 2018. Nonetheless. due to some procedural obstacles. the Assembly Committee for Legislation has returned the Strategy for re-approval to the Government. which happened in November 2018. Currently. the 2018-2022 Anti-corruption Strategy (which now should read 2019 – 2023) is again with the Assembly Committee for Legislation and will be sent for further processing through the Assembly during the first quarter of 2019.

title.narrative: E-MECHANISMS FOR CORRUPTION DETECTION AND PROCESSING ESTABLISHED
E-MECHANISMS FOR CORRUPTION DETECTION AND PROCESSING ESTABLISHED

target.value: 3.1. CSOs receive feedback on the institutional efforts to fight corruption at least 3 times by year 2017

actual.value:
3.1. The project continues to act as facilitator between Kallxo.xom and anti-Corruption institutions. in terms of feedback and information sharing.
However. the project will change the format of the dialogue in the manner that Kallxo.com will choose three of their ‘best cases’ and discuss those cases with A/C institutions and see what were the reasons that they were not processed further by the institutions.
Since the project started (2016) kallxo.com has submitted in total 456 cases to anti-corruption institutions.

target.value: E-declarations established for public officials assets and income. E-tool for case management system of preliminary investigations within KACA established

actual.value: The KACA has provided no-objection to ToR for the online platform (Data Management System. DMS) that will allow more transparent. qualitative and efficient monitoring. DMS enables systematic and thorough enquiries of asset declaration for establishing paths that may lead to potential conflict of interest that require further investigation by the Agency. SAEK II initiated the procurement to develop the DMS. an open and competitive process. with 7 companies. including offers from non-Kosovo companies. The winning bidder was notified. and SAEK II helped establish means of communication between the company. the contractor. and KACA. SAEK II was heavily involved in coordinating meetings to ensure proper implementation and requirements. The project supported drafting of legal amendments for introducing e-declaration. as a prerequisite for the system to be fully used by en-users (high public officials). The main parts of the case management system has been developed and is being tested.

title.narrative: ANTI-CORRUPTION MONITORING FRAMEWORK ESTABLISHED AND FUNCTIONAL
ANTI-CORRUPTION MONITORING FRAMEWORK ESTABLISHED AND FUNCTIONAL

target.value: Local and central institutions supported with integrity management systems

actual.value: By end of 2016 currently. 17 municipalities that have developed or are at the development stage of Integrity Plans.

target.value: Monitoring mechanism for the Anti-corruption Strategy and Action Plan established Scheduled for 2019-2020.

actual.value: Establishment of a permanent monitoring mechanism in the new Anti-corruption Strategy and amendments to the Law will commence in 2019-2020. The project was involved in official coordination fora that contribute to oversight of implementation of anti-corruption measures and improve multilateral coordination. Collaboration between SAEK and other internationally funded organization is effective. UNDP proposed that members of the Partnership Briefing come up with policy priorities to be agreed and presented to the authorities to help set an anti-corruption agenda. The last partnership briefing contributed to better coordination of marking the international anti-corruption day. Considering that the partnership forum is the only functioning informal coordination mechanism for anti-corruption. meetings contributed to minimizing potential duplication and improving sending messages to authorities in line with the priorities of all main international actors in the field of anti-corruption.

target.value: 1. % of measures implemented of integrity plans. needs to be amended with qualitative indicators. otherwise on the easy ones can be implemented. but not the tough ones. 2. Level of satisfaction by the citizens with fight against corruption for target institutions.

actual.value:
ad. 1. Prishtina and Gjakova have implemented most of the measures to improve transparency. The rest of the municipalities have recently developed the integrity plans therefore no measurements have been conducted yet.
ad. 2. Satisfaction with judiciary (Nov 2017) – 36.9% towards 2020 target.
Satisfaction with prosecution (Nov 2017) – 33.1% towards 2020 target.

GAP continued to ensure that public expenditure is transparently displayed. To this end the project has supported the GAP institute in establishing a user-friendly online service that allows people to view and understand how public budgets are spent in relation to budgetary planning. The GAP institute also educated students and the public on budget making and spending processes. The support resulted in 22 central level institutions. 33 independent agencies. 38 municipalities having their budgets transparently presented on the GAP institute website. With these achievements the targets set for this output have been met. This activity has been implemented smoothly and will be completed in 2019.

title.narrative: Policy, regulatory and monitoring framework on the prevention and suppression of corruption enhanced
Policy, regulatory and monitoring framework on the prevention and suppression of corruption enhanced

target.value: 1.1 5 laws fully in line with UNCAC and international standards by 2020 (status: CoI entered into force; Law on Judges Liability awaiting president’s signature; Political Party Financing with the AoK; Law on KACA and Law on Assets at the MoJ working group drafting level) 1.2 70% in 2017 of the first strategy. 25% in 2020 of the second strategy (status: 70% completed in the first strategy; strategy 2 not yet adopted but measures underway) 1.3 25 integrity plans adopted and 10 monitored by 2020 (status: 21 adopted. 0 monitored till 2018)

title.narrative: EFFECTIVE INSTITUTIONAL COMMUNICATION ON CORRUPTION CASES ESTABLISHED
EFFECTIVE INSTITUTIONAL COMMUNICATION ON CORRUPTION CASES ESTABLISHED

actual.value: The communication strategy was completed in 2017.

Two coordination meetings with CSOs and the media were held during the reporting period. The embedded communications adviser within the KACA has completed his assignment and his contract will expire in January 2019. Increased understanding of the work of the KACA and improved coordination with CSOs and the media. During the reporting period the KACA came under considerable fie by the PM’s office for issuing a decision that the PM’s decision to increase salaries was in conflict of interest. This was handled in a subtle manner of press releases but could perhaps have been responded to head on through a press conference.

title.narrative: CIVIC ENGAGEMENT PLATFORMS FOR CORRUPTION REPORTING, REFERRAL AND MONITORING SUPPORTED
CIVIC ENGAGEMENT PLATFORMS FOR CORRUPTION REPORTING, REFERRAL AND MONITORING SUPPORTED

actual.value:
The platform kallxo.com continues. and was used by citizens during 2018. In total 2.374 cases was reported; and the team of researchers managed to complete 648. As a result of the corruption reporting. a number of results were achieved: 1 judge suspended; 1 decision of the government cancelled; 2 selection for hiring public officials reviewed; 7 policemen suspended; 1 public worker dismissed; 2 business activities suspended; 2 disciplinary actions against judges and persecutors initiated.
The meetings between Kallxo.com and the anti-corruption institutions started in February 2018 and continue to underline different positions towards specific cases following referrals to 3 of the anti-corruption institutions. Differences are merely in relation to viewpoint that Kallxo.com has towards elements of case versus the viewpoints that anti-corruption institutions have towards the same elements (i.e. whether an action of subject constitutes breach ethics or other compliance instruments).
